docs.snippet: MILFORD, Conn., Sept. 13 -- Adding two second places to his triumph yesterday, Thomas G. Allen of Buffalo maintained his lead as the International Lightning Class Association's first world sailing championship continued today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MILFORD, Conn., Sept. 13 -- Adding two second places to his triumph yesterday, Thomas G. Allen of Buffalo maintained his lead as the International Lightning Class Association's first world sailing championship continued today.

headline.main: ALLEN KEEPS LEAD IN MILFORD SAILING

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 13 -- Argentina has announced an ambitious plan of replacing her entire state-owned merchant fleet by 1970 with the building of four passenger liners and fifty freighters.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 13 -- Argentina has announced an ambitious plan of replacing her entire state-owned merchant fleet by 1970 with the building of four passenger liners and fifty freighters.
docs.abstract: Govt plans replacement of entire fleet by '70

headline.main: ARGENTINA PLANS NEW TRADE FLEET; 4 Liners and 50 Freight Ships Projected by 1970

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange slipped hour after hour yesterday. Volume was lighter than on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange slipped hour after hour yesterday. Volume was lighter than on Wednesday.

headline.main: STOCK PRICES SAG AS TRADING DROPS; Index Slides 3.29 Points -- Electronics, Nonferrous Metals, Oils Weak NO GROUP SHOWS A GAIN 2 Depressing Factors Are G.M. Labor Dispute and Fears Over Berlin STOCK PRICES SAG AS TRADING EASES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 15 -- Dr. Janio Quadros, former President of Brazil, arrived here today by ship. He refused to comment on the reasons behind his resignation last month.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 15 -- Dr. Janio Quadros, former President of Brazil, arrived here today by ship. He refused to comment on the reasons behind his resignation last month.

headline.main: QUADROS IN LONDON; Brazil's Ex-Chief Declines to Discuss Resignation

docs.snippet: Dr. Samuel Guy Inman, a promoter of Latin-American friendship for more than half a century, returned from the Southern Hemisphere last week after opening another program for good neighborliness.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 12 -- Argentine-Chilean relations took on a cordial official tone this week as a result of President Arturo Frondizi's visit to Chile. But long-standing frontier disputes were not solved.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 12 -- Argentine-Chilean relations took on a cordial official tone this week as a result of President Arturo Frondizi's visit to Chile. But long-standing frontier disputes were not solved.
docs.abstract: visit ends; communique stresses cordiality of talks and pledge to consult on mutual problems

headline.main: VISIT BY FRONDIZI AIDS TIES TO CHILE; Disputes Remain Unsettled but Talks Are Cordial

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 16 -- Eighteen Snipe Class boats that never had been under sail before engaged in two tune-up races today. The contests were the first steps toward more serious business afloat that will begin on Monday, when the world championship...
docs.lead_paragraph: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 16 -- Eighteen Snipe Class boats that never had been under sail before engaged in two tune-up races today. The contests were the first steps toward more serious business afloat that will begin on Monday, when the world championship regatta for these little giants of the waterways will begin on Long Island Sound.

headline.main: Kelly Takes First Two Tune-Up Races for Snipe Title Sail; NASSAU SKIPPER TOPS FLEET OF 18 Kelly Dominates Tune-Ups for World Snipe Series Beginning Tomorrow

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CANELONES Uruguay, Sept. 17 -- Benito Nardone, member of Uruguay's nine-man Executive Council, assailed the country's system of government in an address here today as "inefficient."
docs.lead_paragraph: CANELONES Uruguay, Sept. 17 -- Benito Nardone, member of Uruguay's nine-man Executive Council, assailed the country's system of government in an address here today as "inefficient."
docs.abstract: Council member B Nardone assails Council form of Govt as inefficient; opens drive for Pres system

headline.main: URUGUAY CHANGE URGED; Council Member Opens Drive for Presidential System
